intro: Schiedea diffusa subsp. macraei, commonly known as the Macrae’s hoary kalanchoe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to survive in arid conditions due to its thick, water-storing leaves. Schiedea diffusa subsp. macraei is also recognized for its ecological importance in supporting local insect pollinators.
